recipe.title: White Pasta with Beef

preparation.step: Add uncooked pasta, water, and broth to a large stockpot. Slice onion and add to pot along with basil, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Cover and cook on medium-high, bringing to a boil. Remove cover and cook for 8-10 minutes or until liquid has completely absorbed, stirring occasionally.
Meanwhile, spray a skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium. Add beef and cook until browned, stirring to crumble.
Add beef to cooked pasta. Stir in cream cheese, 2-3 tablespoons of fresh lemon juice, zest of lemon, and Parmesan cheese.
Serve with orange wedges on the side.

recipe.comment: A healthy and yummy recipe for dinner for kids, who are picky eaters.

recipe.title: Chicken and Brown Rice

ingredient.name: soup, cream of chicken, canned, condensed

preparation.step: Push “saute” button on Instant Pot. While it heats, dice onion, mince garlic, and chop veggies. Rinse and drain rice.
When pot says “HOT,” add oil to pot and saute onions for 3 minutes. Then press “cancel” to turn the saute setting off.

Mix veggies, garlic, rice, and broth into the pot. Place chicken on top, salt and pepper, then cover with cream of chicken soup (homemade is preferable) and Worchestershire sauce. Place 8-10 small sprigs of thyme on top. NOTE: chicken breasts also work well, just make sure to cut them in half so they’re not too thick.

Seal the Instant Pot, close the vent, and press “manual.” Use the “pressure” button to toggle to high pressure. For brown rice: set the time for 25 minutes. For white rice: set the timer for 20 minutes. After 10 seconds the pot should register that it has begun the pressurizing process.

Once the pot is done cooking open the vent (keep your hand out of the path of the steam) to quick release the pressure. This should take about 2 minutes. Once pressure has released completely (the pin drops) the pot is safe to open.
Remove thyme sprigs (keeping leaves when possible). Stir pot to shred chicken and mix in any extra liquid. Serve warm.

recipe.comment: It’s delicious and comforting. If creamy, savory rice, flavorful veggies, and fall-apart tender chicken sound like your thing, you should try this recipe.

recipe.title: Breakfast Egg Cups

preparation.step: Spray a muffin tin with cooking spray and set aside. Preheat oven to 375°F.
Whisk the eggs and milk together in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper.
Dice the bell pepper into small pieces. Stack the spinach leaves, roll them up, and slice them thin. (This method is called chiffonade.)
Add the peppers, spinach, and shredded cheddar to the egg mixture.
Fill muffin cups 3/4 full and bake for 20-25 minutes until centers are set and no longer runny.
Allow to cool slightly before serving.

recipe.comment: This recipe is the perfect breakfast on-the-go. Make them ahead of time, refrigerate or freeze them, and then heat them in the microwave when you are ready to eat!
